meanings.definition: Having a red or flushed complexion.
meanings.sent1: After running, his face looked florid and warm.
meanings.sent2: The sunburn made her cheeks florid and rosy.
meanings.sent3: The florid color of his face after eating spicy food was quite noticeable.
meanings.sent4: Her embarrassment was so intense that her face turned florid in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The florid hue of his cheeks made him resemble a ripe tomato.

meanings.definition: Elaborately or excessively intricate or complicated in style.
meanings.sent1: The florid design of the wallpaper was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style was so florid that it was hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: The florid details in the story made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent4: The florid language used in the speech was like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The florid decorations in the room made it feel like a royal palace.

meanings.definition: Decorated with flowers or floral patterns.
meanings.sent1: The florid curtains in the living room added a touch of nature.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was adorned with florid patterns of roses.
meanings.sent3: The florid tablecloth brought a garden-like feel to the dining room.
meanings.sent4: The florid wallpaper in the bedroom made it feel like a blooming garden.
meanings.sent5: The florid china set on the table was a delight to behold.
